newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot gas prices soften on moderating weather.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot gas prices soften on moderating weather.

text.p: U.S. spot natgas prices erased Monday's minor gains on Tuesday as temperatures moderated across most of the U.S. and storage supplies were ample, sources said.
Swing Gulf Coast pipes eased about five to six cents to the high-$2.20s to mid-$2.30s, down about 60 cents from index levels.

Similarly in south Texas prices slipped into the mid-to-high $2.20s, down more than five cents from Monday. Temperatures in the state are forecast to remain slightly below normal throughout this week.
In west Texas, Permian prices fell about three cents to the mid-$2.20s as most buyers relied on storage instead of entering the spot market.
Swing prices at the southern California border were quoted about 10 cents lower in the $2.32-2.41 range.
In the Midcontinent, prices were mostly steady in the low-$2.30s as most of the region anticipated the coldest day of the week on Wednesday.
Chicago city-gate values were talked in the mid-to-high $2.40s.

In the East, New York city-gate gas prices dropped about 10 cents to the $2.75-2.90 range. Despite a brief spell of cold, snowy weather expected this week, temperatures in the Mid-Atlantic states are forecast to return to normal by Friday.
